snippet: The company has a greater share of the sluggish Western European market than its rivals but it said its operating profit in developing economies made up half its earnings.
abstract: Heineken has a greater share of the sluggish Western European market than its rivals but it says its operating profit in developing economies made up half its first-half earnings; operating profit before one-time expenses grew 5 percent, to 1.45 billion euros ($1.94 billion).
lead_paragraph: The company has a greater share of the sluggish Western European market than its rivals but it said its operating profit in developing economies made up half its earnings.
